content: अभिभवः {@--1@} Defeat, subjugation, subjection, overpowering; इतरेतरानभिभवेन मृगास्तमुपासते गुरुमिवांतसदः <ls>Ki. 6. 34</ls> (<ab>cf.</ab> <ls>K. 45</ls> and the Bible “The wolf shall also dwell with the lamb” &c.); <ls n="Ki.">8. 28</ls>; स्पर्शानुकूला इव सूर्यकांतास्तदन्यतेजोभिभवाद्वमंति <ls>Ś. 2. 7</ls> when assailed, opposed, overpowered by another energy; अभिभवः कुत एव सपत्नजः <ls>R. 9. 4</ls>, <ls n="R.">4. 21.</ls> {@--2@} Being overpowered; जराभिभवविच्छायं <ls>K. 346</ls>; being attacked or affected, stupefied (by fever &c.); न रोगशांतिर्न चाभिभवः <ls>Suśr.</ls> {@--3@} Contempt, disrespect; निरभिभवसाराः परकथाः <ls>Bh. 2. 64.</ls> {@--4@} Humiliation, mortification (of pride); अलभ्यशोकाभिभवेयमाकृतिः <ls>Ku. 5. 43</ls>; <ls>K. 195.</ls> {@--5@} Predominance, prevalence, rise, spread; अधर्माभिभवात्कृष्ण प्रदुष्यंति कुलस्त्रियः <ls>Bg. 1. 41</ls>; <ls>Ki. 2. 37.</ls>
